full_threads.body:
Hi @heath, I checked the page again and base on there comments I found out that the noscript code is belong to the original website (3rd party system.)

https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/home-loan-specials/

Attached the screenshot and I tried also to apply a code to removed the noscript but not lucky... by the way @joel,  do you know what is the other idea on how to removed the noscript?

original link
https://www.visionabacus.net/Tools/B3/SuiteA/Z100/HowMuchYouCouldSave?LivePI=3.59&LiveIO=3.79&InvestPI=4.19&InvestIO=4.39

Thanks :)

Apologies, it is Black Friday isn't it !





Hi, Jo



I have looked at your webpage code. The iframe code appears twice




The second one is inside tag <noscript>. This tag is for javscript disabled.





Can you ask your web designers to remove the second iframe code inside tag <noscript>.





Thanks





Kang








Jo Carroll | Client Services Director | Mortgage Directt +61 2 9302 0588 m 0418 700 755 toll free 1300 360 999
Level 33, MLC Building, 19 Martin Place Sydney NSW 2000

Hi Jo, 

The page is now here: https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/home-loan-specials/ as requested. 

Regarding the second part of your email... 

"We have a problem with the calculator on the mobile, see Kang's comments below." - I don't think anything came through on your email about this.

@manuel I'm not sure what the mean either haha. 

Leave it with me, I will ask, Cheers

@heath done update the name of the landing page. but may I know what the other problem regarding the mobile display?

Thanks.

Hi Heath



We have a problem with the calculator on the mobile, see Kang's comments below.



We want to put the landing page live, I can't see it in the back end but it must be there, can you please change the name from landing page

to home loan specials



many thanks




Jo Carroll | Client Services Director | Mortgage Directt +61 2 9302 0588 m 0418 700 755 toll free 1300 360 999

cheers

Hi Jo, 

We have fixed the button. 

Regarding the heading changes on the calculator, they need to be done by the company that created the calculator I'm afraid. We can't access those parts.

@manuel I have fixed the button now and will tell her the other changes to the calculator need to be done in the other system. 

Cheers

@heath sorry, I confuse for this instruction.. may I know what it mean?

"the heading on the calculator needs to be updated and the current loan as upper and lower case as per attached."

This instruction is done "We also need the buttons to go through to the call button at the bottom of the page".

Thanks

Hi Heath, thanks for sending this through, the heading on the calculator needs to be updated and the current loan as upper and lower case as per attached.



We also need the buttons to go through to the call button at the bottom of the page



Let me know if you have any queries,







Best regards




Jo Carroll | Client Services Director | Mortgage Directt +61 2 9302 0588 m 0418 700 755 toll free 1300 360 999

attachments.filename: Find Out How Much You Could Be Saving.docx

full_threads.body:
Hi Jo, 

Hope you are well, we have made the requested updates and it's ready for your review: https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/landing-page/
@heath please you can check it now.

From: John Cassimatis <team@hellohandsome.com.au>
Sent: Wednesday, 14 November 2018 4:46 PM
To: Jo Carroll <jo.carroll@mortgagedirect.com.au>
Subject: Re: Mortgage Direct landing page


"with our home loan specials” the line height needs to be adjusted so its higher

All of the rate numbers should be closer to the lines above it and it will help with the height of that area. The terms marks should be in a <sup> tag and be a lot smaller in font size

The "New home loans with principal and interest repayments” should be regular font and not bold.

“New” is repeated, sorry that was my fault in my design.

The “Talk" button needs to have the font larger and the padding of the box adjusted. The hover state should go to the blue colour and have a timing transition. It should link to something???

"Request a call from a home loan specialist now” text needs to be restyled like the design and the padding on top reduced so its closer to the savings output. The hover state should be blue and have a timing transition

"We’ll review your home loan to help you save by switching to Mortgage Direct” line height should increase from 1.1em to 1.3em

“Talk to us now” link under the paragraph should have gold hover state and have a timing transition.

The Call text needs to be the same weight as the Book and Chat text.

The top and bottom padding of the terms text area needs to be reduced.

The white footer area needs to be disabled and not there.

These are little things that will bring it closer to the design.




Thanks!





[http://www.hellohandsome.com.au/signature/handsome-logo.png]

John Cassimatis 0414 071 901
hellohandsome.com.au ABN. 29 159 865 648

Hi Heath



Apologies for the delay in getting back to you. I've had John at Handsome have a look at the layout and will send his

comments separately.



I've attached a screen shot of the calculator with the correct default interest rates. And would appreciate if you could

update the copy as shown



If you have any queries or suggestions please give me a call or email





cheers

Level 33, MLC Building, 19 Martin Place Sydney NSW 2000

Regarding the fonts not being the same size etc. If your view looks different from the design still, would you be able to either send us a screen shot or let us know which website browser you are using, as it looks great at our end.

Hi Heath,



I've had a look at the landing page and it's not the same fonts as the design and the text is different sizes from the design.



This is going to be a page on the website so it should look like the others.



Is it possible to make sure the calculator is not inside a frame on the landing page?


Currently in responsive mode it is within a frame.

See below

Hi Jo, 

Here is a link to the draft landing page: https://www.mortgagedirect.com.au/landing-page/

I have a couple of questions: 

  1. There are some 'let's talk' links. Did you want us to link these to the contact us page? 
  2. Are you ok with default values for interest rates? We can preload these with a more accurate value if need be?
@manuel looks great - thanks I will send to the client for review now.
@heath but doesn't have an entry field to input as what I suggest... so that, they can changed automatically on the page not on the url.
